{{URL|example.com}} --> | footnotes = }} '''Trelleborg Municipality''' (''Trelleborgs kommun'') is the southernmost [[Municipalities of Sweden|municipality]] of [[Sweden]], in [[Skåne County]]. Its seat is located in the city [[Trelleborg]]. The present municipality was created in 1967 through the amalgamation of the ''City of Trelleborg'' with five rural municipalities. It consists of over thirty original local government units. The municipality boasts 35 kilometers of predominantly sandy beach in the south, [[beech]] woods to the north, and in between one of the most fertile soils in the world.{{Citation needed|date=August 2010}} ==Localities== There are 8 [[Urban areas in Sweden|urban area]]s (also called a Tätort or locality) in Trelleborg Municipality. In the table they are listed according to the size of the population as of December 31, 2005. The municipal seat is in bold characters. {| class="wikitable" ! # !! Locality !! Population |- | 1 || '''[[Trelleborg]]''' || 25,643 |- | 2 || [[Anderslöv]] || 1,680 |- | 3 || [[Gislövs läge och Simremarken]] || 1,462 |- | 4 || [[Smygehamn]] || 1,174 |- | 5 || [[Skegrie]] || 745 |- | 6 || [[Beddingestrand]] || 644 |- | 7 || [[Klagstorp]] || 341 |- | 8 || [[Alstad]] || 252 |} ==References== *[http://www.scb.se Statistics Sweden] {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.trelleborg.se/ Trelleborg Municipality] - Official site * [http://www.trelleborg.se/t_templates/t_Page____1717.aspx History] (Used on April 29, 2005) {{Skåne County}} {{Localities in Trelleborg Municipality}} {{coord|55|22|N|13|10|E|region:SE_type:adm2nd|display=title}} [[Category:Municipalities of Skåne County]] [[Category:Municipalities of Sweden]]
